verses.verse: ((2 Wisdom calleth all to her feast.7 The scorner will not be corrected.10 The fear of God.13 The conditions of the harlot.) ) Wisdom hath built her (Christ hath prepared him a Church.) house, and hewn out her (That is, many chief stays and principal parts of his Church, as were the Patriarchs, Prophets, Apostles, Pastors, and Doctors.) seven pillars.
She hath killed her victuals, drawn her wine, and (He compareth wisdom with great princes that keep open house for all that come.) prepared her table.
She hath sent forth her (Meaning, true preachers, which are not infected with man’s wisdom.) maidens, and crieth upon the highest places of the city, saying,
Who so is (He that knoweth his own ignorance, and is void of malice.) simple, let him come hither, and to him that is destitute of wisdom, she saith,

Come, and eat of my (By the meat and drink, is meant the word of God, and the ministration of the Sacraments, whereby God nourisheth his servants in his house, which is the Church.) meat, and drink of the wine that I have drawn.
Forsake your way, ye foolish, and ye shall live: and walk in the way of understanding.
He that reproveth a scorner, purchaseth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh the wicked, getteth himself a (For the wicked will contemn him and labor to defame him.) blot.

Rebuke not a (Meaning them that are incorrigible, which Christ calleth dogs and swine: or he speaketh this in comparison, not that the wicked should not be rebuked, but he showeth their malice, and the small hope of profit.) scorner, lest he hate thee: but rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
Give admonition to the wise, and he will be the wiser: teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.

The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the Lord, and the knowledge of holy things, is (He showeth what true understanding is, to know the will of God in his word which is meant by holy things.) understanding.
For thy days shall be multiplied by me, and the years of thy life shall be augmented.
If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for (Thou shalt have the chief profit and commodity thereof.) thyself, and if thou be a scorner, thou alone shalt suffer.

¶ A (By the foolish woman, some understand the wicked preachers, who counterfeit the word of God: as appeareth verse 16, which were the words of the true preachers, as verse 4, but their doctrine is but as stolen waters: meaning, that they are but men’s traditions, which are more pleasant to the flesh than the word of God, and therefore they themselves boast thereof.) foolish woman is troublesome; she is ignorant and knoweth nothing.
But she sitteth at the door of her house on a seat in the high places of the city,
To call them that pass by the way, that go right on their way, saying,
Who so is simple let him come hither, and to him that is destitute of wisdom, she saith also,
Stolen waters are sweet, and hid bread is pleasant.
But he knoweth not, that the dead are there, and that her guests are in the depth of hell.
